<!-- BASIC CONCEPTS (Introduction) -->
[^ekc]: **EKC** (Environmental Kuznets Curve) — Hypothesis of an inverted U-shaped relationship between pollution and income. Details: @sec-concepts-fondamentaux

[^owid]: **Our World in Data** — Academic repository harmonizing GCP + World Bank data. https://ourworldindata.org

[^ppa]: **PPP** (Purchasing Power Parity) — GDP adjustment for international comparability.

<!-- ESTIMATORS (Methodology) -->
[^ols]: **OLS** — Ordinary Least Squares. Principle: @sec-ols

[^hc3]: **HC3** — Heteroskedasticity correction (N<250). Formula: @sec-hc3

[^nw]: **Newey-West (HAC)** — Autocorrelation correction (time series). Formula: @sec-nw

[^ardl]: **ARDL** — Dynamic model (lags of Y and X). Specification: @sec-ardl

<!-- STATISTICAL TESTS -->
[^adf]: **ADF** (Augmented Dickey-Fuller) — Unit root test. H₀: non-stationarity. Details: @sec-adf

[^test-f]: **Nested F-test** — Compares nested models. Formula: @sec-test-f

[^aic]: **AIC** (Akaike Information Criterion) — Balances goodness of fit/parsimony. Lower is better. Formula: @sec-aic

[^jb]: **Jarque-Bera** — Normality test (H₀: normal residuals). Details: @sec-jarque-bera

[^dw]: **Durbin-Watson** — Detects first-order autocorrelation. DW≈2 = no autocorrelation. Details: @sec-durbin-watson

<!-- OTHERS -->
[^ndc]: **NDC** (Nationally Determined Contributions) — Climate commitments under the Paris Agreement.

[^rmse]: **RMSE** (Root Mean Squared Error) — Penalizes large errors.

[^cv]: **Cross-validation** — Tests generalization on unseen data. Method: @sec-validation
